str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From hamartano; a sin.
From hos and pos; what(-ever) how, i.e. In the manner that (as adverb or conjunction of coincidence, intentional or actual).

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ek and haireomai; actively, to tear out; middle voice, to select; figuratively, to release.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: From en and histemi; to place on hand, i.e. impend, be instant.
Evil, bad, wicked, malicious, slothful.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An act of will, will; plur: wishes, desires. From the prolonged form of ethelo; a determination, i.e. choice or inclination.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
And, even, also, namely.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
